# Training on accessing, processing, and curating datasets 2025

EMO-BON establishes a long-term omics observatory for marine biodiversity through bimonthly 
sampling of coastal waters and both soft and hard sediments across more than 20 stations in Europe. 
Standard operating procedures are applied for sample collection, sequencing, and workflow analysis 
to ensure consistent taxonomic and functional annotation. FAIR principles are implemented using 
appropriate ontologies, RO-Crates, and a Python-based data analysis toolkit prepared for deployment 
in Virtual Research Environments (VREs).
